Package com.intellij.openapi.editor

Class VisualPosition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.editor.VisualPosition

  • public class VisualPosition
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a visual position in the editor. Visual positions take folding into account - for example, if the top 10 lines of the document are folded, the 10th line in the document will have the line number 1 in its visual position.

    Visual position corresponds to a boundary between two characters and can be associated with either a preceding or succeeding character (see leansRight). This association makes a difference in a bidirectional text, where a mapping from visual to logical position is not continuous.

    See Also:
    LogicalPosition, Editor.logicalToVisualPosition(LogicalPosition), Editor.offsetToVisualPosition(int), Editor.xyToVisualPosition(java.awt.Point)

    • Field Detail

      • line

        public final int line

      • column

        public final int column

      • leansRight

        public final boolean leansRight
        If true, this position is associated with succeeding character (in visual order), otherwise it's associated with preceding character. This can make difference in bidirectional text, where visual positions which differ only in this flag's value can correspond to a different logical positions.

        This field has no impact on equality and comparison relationships between VisualPosition instances.

    • Method Detail

      • after

        public boolean after(VisualPosition other)
        Allows to answer if current visual position is located after the given one.

        One visual position is considered to be 'after' another only if one of the following is true: 

         
          
   
        • its visual line is greater;
          • 
   
        • it has the same visual line but its column is greater;
          •
        Parameters:
        other - visual position to compare with the current one
        Returns:
        true if current position is 'after' the given one; false otherwise

      • leanRight

        public VisualPosition leanRight(boolean value)
        Constructs a new VisualPosition instance with a given value of leansRight flag.
